home.sprintDescription: Sprints are intensive development session on an open source project of your choice, in a team environment. It's a time to come together with colleagues, old and new, to share what you've learned and apply it to an open source project. Is this your first time joining in Sprints? No problem! It will be the time that you learn directly from the open source contributors. Sprint sessions are not just limited to the projects using Python, all languages are welcome!
home.tutorialDescription: Tutorials are educational programs for beginners, or challengers for new era. Tutorial mentors and tutors will guide you to easy way of learning. We recommend tutorials for beginner programmers or Python strangers.
home.conferenceDescription: There are over 50 different presentation sessions that share knowledge and use of Python use cases. In addition, various events such as sponsored company booth, young coder, lightning talk, open space are available. You can participate in the event and interact with various participants.

sponsor.title: Looking for sponsors for PyCon Korea 2019
sponsor.description1: Thanks to all the sponsors who supported the importance of open source and Python community, we could organize an event that more programmers can attend by providing many speech sessions, side programs, video recordings and financial aid.
sponsor.description2: We are currently looking for the official sponsors for PyCon Korea 2019 who are interested in supporting the growth of Python community.

home.pyconKoreaDescription: PyCon is a non-commercial conference held by Python Programming Communities over the world. PyCon Korea has been successfully hold in several years with a group of volunteers called ‚ÄòPyCon Korea Preparation Organizers‚Äô, who support the local Korean Python community.
home.sloganDescription1: The slogan of PyCon Korea 2019 is "Connect the Pythonistas".
home.sloganDescription2: PyCon can be a place where Python users meet, or a place that connects with other languages or communities. In PyCon, you can meet someone who is researching deeply on one thing, another Pythonista from a different field, or a friend of yours.
home.sloganDescription3: With PyCon, we want all the Pythonistas who are in different fields and heading to different directions to get together and become an awesome constellation. See you again at PyCon Korea 2019.

differenceWithOthers.title: What's the difference between PyCon and other developer's conferences?
differenceWithOthers.description: PyCon Korea is a non-profitable, developer-oriented event organized by community members, and has different characteristics from conferences organized companies or organizations. All attendees, including speakers, tutorial hosts, voluntary workers, and organizers, participate in PyCon Korea without any profitable purpose, and only to broaden the usage of Python, an open source programming language, and activate its community.

overview.title: Various ways to contribute to PyCon Korea
overview.intro: You can contribute to PyCon Korea in various ways including keynote, speaker, tutorial, sprint, volunteer and lightning talk. We will recruit each item with the following schedule.

recommendKeynoteSpeaker.title: Recommending Keynote Speaker
recommendKeynoteSpeaker.description1: We are looking for PyCon Korea 2019 Keynote Speaker to be the Polaris of Pythonistas.
recommendKeynoteSpeaker.description2: If you know someone who is actively using Python for life/work/hobbies, please do not hesitate to recommend it.

cfpGuide.title: How to submit proposal
cfpGuide.intro: This page has written to provide detailed information for speakers of PyCon Korea. Below information and suggestion will guide your presentation to be more informative and persuasive to audience in PyCon Korea.

notice.title: Guide for Speakers

record.title: Session recording
record.content: All session of PyCon Korea will be recorded and open to public after conference. Please consider this before you submit your proposal.

pays.title: Everybody Pays
pays.content: PyCon is Python community's voluntary event. Please understand we are not able to provide all the material expense supports (pay, expenses, free tickets) to our speakers. Regards on this matter, please visit page explains about PyCon‚Äôs main value and philosophy "Everybody Pays" .

vote.title: Voting preference
vote.content: Also, first screened proposal will be voted by early bird ticket holders. The purpose of this vote is to find out preference and interest of sessions and rate those voted proposals. Program team will select final speakers based on preference vote to make this event more fun and enjoyable to as many audience as possible.

communication.title: Continuing communication
communication.content: For the last, please understand the moment you submit your proposal and till it get selected, there will be continuing communication with program team. We recommend you to submit your proposal earlier before its deadline to communicate with program team to build your talk session more fun and informative.

notice.conclusion: If you‚Äôre all familiar with guidance now, are you ready to start your proposal?

beforeProposal.title: Before you start to fill your proposal

consider.description: There are a few things to consider before working on proposal.
consider.item1: What is your main topic? What would you like to talk about?
consider.item3: What can your audience get from your talk?
consider.item4: How would you manage time in your session?

information.description: Also, below information must be included in your proposal.

header.visibility: Visibility at the time of vote

category.title: Category
category.desc: You can see the list of categories on the proposal page.

note.title: Note or Question
note.desc: Only PyCon Korea Organizer can view this section, so feel free to write in any form

information.conclusion: Only title, summary, details, target audience, time slot, and language will be disclosed to early bird holders during preference vote.

beforeProposal.conclusion: Do you feel a little bit overwhelmed with all these criteria? Don't worry! Real guidance is now here. We'll help you with detailed information about how to work on your proposal.

selectTopic.title: Select a topic
selectTopic.description: The best way to select a topic is to review topics from previous PyCon event. Not only look for topic, but also get the reference from presentation slides will help you start. Choose interesting topic for audience!
selectTopic.conclusion: Once you decide your topic, now you can start thinking about what should be on your proposal in detailed level. Check below information for help.

proposalType.title: Good proposal vs Not good proposal

good.title: Good proposal üëç
good.item1: Include below information on your summary/details section.
good.item1-1: What kind of background does audience need to understand this talk?
good.item1-2: What will audience gain after attend this talk?
good.item2: Write presentation flow and estimate time of your talk.
good.item3: If your topic is not familiar to most of Python users, Please include blog address, wiki, source code to help understand topic.

bad.title: Not good proposal üôÖ‚ÄçÔ∏è
bad.item1: Please avoid deliver only simple information such as how to use or advertise your(or your company's) products. However, If you have case at company where you solve programming issue or open source project that helps to audience is more then welcome.
bad.item2: Proposal should be completed and detailed. Incomplete proposal is not acceptable.

difficulty.title: How to target your audience
difficulty.desc1: A good presentation delivers right information to specific target audience with certain Python level.
difficulty.desc1-1: It‚Äôs not a good to talk about solve performance issue to release GIL within C code block which is generated by Cython to beginner level audience.
difficulty.desc1-2: Other cases, basic introduction of Cython or GIL is too easy for expert level audience.
difficulty.desc2: Just like an example above, some cases are easier to select audience than others. but, not all cases are this easy! For those who needs a little more guideline on target audience selection, we have a few things to tell you.

beginner.title: Beginner
beginner.desc1: None or little bit of knowledge about Python. They have basic syntax and control flow knowledge but don‚Äôt have much of knowledge or experience in standard library and programming in general.
beginner.desc2: For topic for beginners, topic like "experience with python" or "how to become intermediate in python programming skill" would be appropriate. Like Pandas or Django, not a built-in package of python is not for beginners.

intermediate.title: Intermediate
intermediate.desc1: Usually, intermediate level audience like to know how python can be utilized in other programming area. Most of them used python for a long time but have less experience in how python can be utilized and used in many other area such as machine learning or data analysis.
intermediate.desc2: For this target audience, use of web framework, machine learning, web traffic monitoring, and automation could be a good topic. Please understand a proposal for intermediate level users may asked to modify its contents to beginner or expert level after review from program team.

experienced.title: Experienced
experienced.desc1: Expert level users are familiar with python programming and general concept of programming. A difference between intermediate and expert is the knowledge and experience of specific field they are in and higher level of programming knowledge.
experienced.desc2: For expert level users, optimization, internals of library, or Python internal is recommended.

talkProposal.description1: We are recruiting a variety of Python-related presentations, such as academic or commercial projects for Python, case studies. Please refer to the Guide for Speakers for more information.

stages1.desc1: The information registered as a speaker profile will be saved in profile and can be edited in My Profile page. The profile will be used in Progam page later.

item1.desc1: In case it's accessive, please provide an external link.

item2.header: Have you presented the material in other events?

stages3.item3: A conference you presented the material
stages3.item4: External link to your presentation material

item5.desc1: Feel free to write comments to reviewers

stages5.desc1: You can check and edit your CFP at Proposal and Application page

prospectus.title: Sponsor Prospectus
prospectus.description1: So, sponsoring this event is the most honest way to show the direction and attitude of the sponsor or individual to the open source community and Python users. In addition, we will support you in various media, sponsor tutorial, sponsor session and booth composition, and you can use it as a place to recruit excellent developers.
prospectus.contactDescription: Please contact us by e-mail and we will send you detailed information about sponsorship.
prospectus.packageDesc: Sponsorship packages may vary by venue and circumstances. And sessions, tutorials and bag inserts provided by sponsors should be served after consultation with PyCon Korea Organizers.
prospectus.boothDesc: The sponsor booth will only be available at conferences that will be held between August 17 (Sat) and 18 (Sun).

goods.header: Goods can be included in eco bag

packages.desc1: Sponsorship Fee does not include VAT. 10% VAT will be added.
packages.desc3: "Goods can be included in eco bag" means that the goods can be included in the eco bag provided to all participants.
packages.desc4: Details may change slightly before the event.
packages.desc5: Community sponsorship is only available for non-commercial organizations.
packages.desc6: Publishing sponsorship: history of publishing for Python book is required.
packages.desc7: Media sponsorship: Any related history for python is required.

coc.title: Code Of Conduct
coc.notice: The PyCon Korea CoC will be updated in May 2019.
coc.desc1: PyCon Korea(henceforth referred as PyCon) is a non-profit community conference intended for networking and collaborating in the developer community.
coc.desc2: We value the participation of each member of the Python community and want all attendees to have an enjoyable and fulfilling experience. Accordingly, all attendees are expected to show respect and courtesy to other attendees throughout the conference and at all conference events, whether officially sponsored by PyCon or not.
coc.desc3: To make clear what is expected, all delegates/attendees, speakers, exhibitors, organizers and volunteers at any PyCon event are required to conform to the following Code of Conduct. Organizers will enforce this code throughout the event.
coc.short1: PyCon is dedicated to providing a harassment-free conference experience for everyone, regardless of gender, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, body size, race, or religion. We do not tolerate harassment of conference participants in any form.
coc.short2: All communication should be appropriate for a professional audience including people of many different backgrounds. Sexual language and imagery is not appropriate for any conference venue, including talks.
coc.short3: Be kind to others. Do not insult or put down other attendees. Behave professionally. Remember that harassment and sexist, racist, or exclusionary jokes are not appropriate for PyCon.
coc.short4: Attendees violating these rules may be asked to leave the conference without a refund at the sole discretion of the conference organizers.
coc.long1: Harassment includes offensive communication related to gender, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, body size, race, religion, sexual images in public spaces, deliberate intimidation, stalking, following, harassing photography or recording, sustained disruption of talks or other events, inappropriate physical contact, and unwelcome sexual attention.
coc.long2: Participants asked to stop any harassing behavior are expected to comply immediately.
coc.long3: Exhibitors in the expo hall, sponsor or vendor booths, or similar activities are also subject to the anti-harassment policy. In particular, exhibitors should not use sexualized images, activities, or other material. Booth staffs (including volunteers) should not wear sexualized clothing/uniforms/costumes, or otherwise create a sexualized environment.
coc.long4: Be careful in the words that you choose. Remember that sexist, racist, and other exclusionary jokes can be offensive to those around you. Excessive swearing and offensive jokes are not appropriate for PyCon.
coc.long5: If a participant engages in behavior that violates this code of conduct, the conference organizers may take any action they deem appropriate, including warning the offender or expulsion from the conference with no refund.
coc.licenseDesc: This Code of Conduct was forked from the example policy from the Geek Feminism wiki, created by the Ada Initiative and other volunteers. which is under a Creative Commons Zero license. github link

agreement.title: Complete the registeration process
agreement.desc1: You have successfully authorized the following account.
agreement.desc2: When you authorize your account, we save the following public information
agreement.desc3: Please complete the registeration process by agreeing to the terms.

fixedFooter.issueTrackerBy: Collaboration tools are supported by Dooray!

privacyPolicy.heading: Privacy Protection Policy
privacyPolicy.paragraph0: 'Privacy Protection Policy' means the guidelines that Python User Group Korea (hereinafter referred to as 'Company') must comply with in order to safeguard the valuable personal information of all users and to use contents and services with peace of mind.
privacyPolicy.title1: Items and Purpose of Collecting Personal Information
privacyPolicy.paragraph1-1: Membership - Collect emails and names as essential for providing content such as sign-up confirmation, identity verification, event guide, and ticket payment within the service.
privacyPolicy.paragraph1-2: Speaker Suggestion - Information such as e-mail, name, English name, phone number, and affiliation are required in order to confirm the identity of the person. It will be used as a guide on web-site/event for participants.
privacyPolicy.paragraph1-3: Personal information that you provide may be modified at any time and personal information will not be provided or used separately from third parties without the consent of the user and we will pay close attention when sharing contents containing personal information.  The user included in each case must submit required data as requested for each item in order to subscribe the service or suggest the speaker the service can be subscribed or suggested, and when the information is submitted, the user is considered to have consented to the collection of personal information.
privacyPolicy.title2: Automatic Collection of Personal Information - Cookies
privacyPolicy.paragraph2: We use cookies to provide convenient services such as personalized content and automatic sign-in to each user. Cookies do not store any personally identifiable information, and you have the option of installing cookies. If you do not want to, you can allow all cookies by setting options in your web browser, check each time a cookie is saved, or refuse to save all cookies. However, if you refuse to install cookies, it may be difficult to provide custom content.
privacyPolicy.title3: Measures to Ensure the Security of Personal Information
privacyPolicy.paragraph3-1: We manage the person in charge of personal information to the minimum. The person in charge carries out necessary measures for access control and controls the unauthorized access from outside using the intrusion prevention system.
privacyPolicy.paragraph3-2: In order to prevent leakage and damage of personal information by hacking or computer virus, security program is installed, periodically renewed / checked, technically and physically monitored and blocked.
privacyPolicy.title4: Measures to Ensure the Security of Personal Information
privacyPolicy.paragraph4-1: All personal information entered by the user will be destroyed without delay in 2 years from the end of the event in that year. Similarly, if a user wants to leave and directly contacts the company, all personal information will be destroyed as well. Information in the form of an electronic file is safely deleted so that it can not be recovered, and destroyed by crushing or incineration in the case of printed matter.
privacyPolicy.paragraph4-2: However, information required to be preserved pursuant to relevant laws and regulations will be retained for a certain period of time.
privacyPolicy.paragraph4-3: Records on the collection, processing, and use of credit information: 3 Years
privacyPolicy.paragraph4-4: Records of consumer complaints or disputes: 3 Years
privacyPolicy.paragraph4-5: Record of payment and goods supply: 5 Years
privacyPolicy.paragraph5-1: We are responsible for the handling of personal information, and we have designated the person responsible for personal information protection as follows in order to handle complaints and damage remedies related to personal information processing. You can contact the person in charge of personal information protection directly about personal information protection inquiries, complaints handling and damage relief.
privacyPolicy.title6: Change of Personal Information Processing Policy
privacyPolicy.paragraph6: If the above privacy policy changes, we will post the change and the changed privacy policy will take effect seven days after the date of posting. However, we will notify you at least 30 days in advance of any significant change in your rights, such as the items of personal information you collect.
